SMW Subobject for Tales of the God Wars (miniquest)Options: ExamineExamine: Feared for invoking Zamorak's wrath on those who have sworn a false oath.Release date: 7 March 2016NPC ID: 22316Is members only: trueIs variant of: Avaryss, the Unceasing

Avaryss, the Unceasing is an Avernic demon and one of the generals of Zamorak's army in The Heart. Along with Nymora, the Vengeful, she is one of the Twin Furies players may fight once they have level 80 Ranged, which can be boosted.

During the God Wars, she and her sisters hunted and killed those who broke their oaths with Zamorak. After Zamorak returned, they led a pack of hellhounds to hunt down the remaining Dragon Riders loyal to Zaros, eventually finding Morvannon and tearing her apart, even though she had changed sides. Satisfied with their work, they continued their services to Zamorak, though they would eventually learn many years later that Morvannon may have had an egg, despite the common belief that the Illujanka were infertile.

At some point after the God Wars, Avaryss's and Nymora's sister was killed by Gregorovic. The duo continued to serve Zamorak while searching for Gregorovic at the same time to exact their revenge.

When Zamorak returned to Gielinor in the Sixth Age, he pointed out that it was possible that Morvannon's dragon Gorvek could have escaped with an egg. Though the sisters desired revenge on Gregorovic for their sister's murder, Zamorak refused to let them do so until they had eliminated the Ilujanka child. This eventually led them to The Heart, where they met both Gregorovic and the Dragon Rider Vindicta, who had survived their genocide millennia ago.

Avaryss yells at Helwyr after the latter attempts to have his revenge on Gregorovic for killing his clansmen, stating that she and Nymora will get their revenge on him for killing their sister. After a short but heated discussion, the two call upon the forces of Zamorak to claim the Heart in his name.

Avaryss is involved in the Daughter of Chaos quest, though without her sister Nymora. Under the orders of K'ril Tsutsaroth, she coordinates attacks against Bilrach's forces during the Zamorakian Civil War in the Wilderness. She is confronted by Moia in the Infernal Source and serves as the final fight in the quest. Upon defeat, Moia traps Avaryss in a diabolus given to her by Trindine before escaping through a rift.

Obtaining all of the Twin Furies unique drops will unlock the title, [Name] the Lone Fury.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Normal Mode[edit | edit source]

At 0% reputation, each kill is worth an average of 80,096.08 coins in uniques alone. If the player has 100% reputation, this increases to 160,192.16 coins.

100% drop[edit | edit source]

Item Quantity Rarity GE price High Alch
Seal of the Furies1–2Always[d 1]Not soldNot alchemisable
Unpowered necromantic seal of the Furies1–2Always[d 2]Not soldNot alchemisable
  1. ^ Only if the player doesn't have maximum reputation with the Serenist, Sliskean and Zarosian factions.
  2. ^ Only if the player is carrying at least 25 greater necroplasm during Kili's Knowledge VII task and doesn't own 10 combined unpowered and powered seals of the Furies. Replaces the normal seal of the Furies drop.

Universal drops are dropped by nearly every monster and skilling action outside of Daemonheim.
These items are dropped alongside main drops.

    Achievements[edit | edit source]

    Main article: Twin Furies achievements
    • Burn, Fury, Burn ( 40) – Defeat the Twin Furies without dealing damage during their channeled[sic] bomb attack. Can only be completed in a solo instance.
    • Bring It All Back ( 40) – Defeat the Twin Furies using fury blades. Can only be completed in a solo instance.
    • Heart to Heart ( 0) – Obtained a collection of unique drops from the Twin Furies.
    • Fast and Furious:
      • Fast and Furious I ( 5) – Defeat Avaryss and Nymora. (X/5)
      • Fast and Furious II ( 5) – Defeat Avaryss and Nymora. (X/10)
      • Fast and Furious III ( 5) – Defeat Avaryss and Nymora. (X/25)
      • Fast and Furious IV ( 5) – Defeat Avaryss and Nymora. (X/50)
      • Fast and Furious V ( 5) – Defeat Avaryss and Nymora. (X/75)
      • Fast and Furious VI ( 5) – Defeat Avaryss and Nymora. (X/100)
    • More Fast More Furious:
      • More Fast More Furious I ( 5) – Defeat Avaryss and Nymora in hard mode. (X/5)
      • More Fast More Furious II ( 5) – Defeat Avaryss and Nymora in hard mode. (X/10)
      • More Fast More Furious III ( 5) – Defeat Avaryss and Nymora in hard mode. (X/25)
      • More Fast More Furious IV ( 5) – Defeat Avaryss and Nymora in hard mode. (X/50)
      • More Fast More Furious V ( 5) – Defeat Avaryss and Nymora in hard mode. (X/75)
      • More Fast More Furious VI ( 5) – Defeat Avaryss and Nymora in hard mode. (X/100)

    Update history[edit | edit source]

    This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
    • update 7 November 2022 (Update):
      • Herb drops replaced with their seeds instead.
    • patch 4 May 2020 (Update):
      • Luminite stone spirits have been replaced by orichalcite and drakolith stone spirits.
    • ninja 10 June 2019 (Update):.
      • The frequency of Necrite and Phasmatite stone spirit drops has been reduced across all God Wars Dungeon 2 bosses.
    • patch 28 January 2019 (Update):
      • Instead of Runite Stone Spirits, will now drop either Necrite Stone Spirits or Phasmatite Stone Spirits.
      • Instead of Coal Stone Spirits, will now drop Luminite Stone Spirits.
    • update 7 March 2016 (Update):
      • Added to game.

    Trivia[edit | edit source]

    • Her name is a play on the word "avarice".
    • Prior to a patch on 4 April 2016, players were able to receive duplicate drops of the same pet if they did not own both Ava and Nylessa pets. E.g. Avaryss' braid could be dropped multiple times after the user unlocked the pet, but before they have unlocked Nylessa pet.
    • Prior to 18 April 2016, killing both the Twin Furies only granted 1 message for the Adventurer's Log. They now both have a separate message.
    • Despite not being immune to poison or typeless damage, poison hitsplats and typeless damage do not damage the shared health pool of Avaryss and Nymora, but still deplete their individual health pool. If one of their individual health pools depletes to 0 before the shared health pool, the boss fight will end.
    • Despite possessing a total shared health pool of 200,000 in normal mode (the same as the other generals apart from Telos), and a total shared health pool of 300,000 in challenge mode, Avaryss, along with her sister have an individual health pool of 250,000 in normal mode, or 350,000 in challenge mode.

    References[edit | edit source]
